intro: Microlicia alsinefolia, commonly known as the lesser microlicia, is a small, annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of about 10-20 centimeters and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pale green flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a useful species for ecological studies in its native environments.
